title: Quinta de la Rosa 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a richly smooth LBV. Superripe black fruits, dried fruits, sultanas and spice are brought together in a generous, full-throated Port. Its tannins are just enough to suggest it could age further, although it is enjoyable now.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Heavily roasted aromas of gamy berry fruits, herbs and coconutty oak settle on charred. This wine is bulky and a touch stewed and soupy in feel. Oaky flavors of chocolate, baked berry and cassis end with chocolaty oak on a finish that's heavy and lacking in verve. Drink through 2024.

title: Real Companhia Velha 2015 Quinta do Síbio Field Blend White (Douro)
description: Set on the plateau above the northern bank of the Douro, this quinta's elevation makes it ideal for white wines. This wine is a field blend of old vines, with creamy rich fruit, baked-apple flavors as well as touches of vanilla and spice. The wine is ripe, full bodied and ready to drink.

title: Rocca di Frassinello 2015 Baffonero  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has aromas of roasted coffee bean, coconut and black-skinned berry. The concentrated palate offers black-currant jam, mocha and bay leaf alongside assertive tannins that grip the finish.

title: Rocca di Montemassi 2015  Maremma Toscana
description: Aromas of cassis, leather and cedar abound on this Syrah, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. The savory juicy palate delivers blackberry jam, tobacco and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Ronco Calino 2011 Brut Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Ripe yellow stone fruit, bread crust and aromatic herb aromas come together on this dry sparkler. The ripe palate delivers yellow apple, peach and a tangerine zest alongside bitter almond. An elegant perlage lends finesse.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Ferrario Famiglia Collection Red (Livermore Valley)
description: A good blast of black cherry and cedar in the aroma is followed by rich grapey flavors on a moderately firm texture that's softened by a hint of sweetness on the finish.

title: Schmitt Söhne 2015 Beerenauslese Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: It's rare to find a beerenauslese at prices like these and luckily, this bottling offers surprising bang for your buck. Dusty and earthen yet chock full of fragrant orange blossom and peach, it's a creamy swirl of honey, fruit and mineral, with a lingering finish. Enjoy now through 2021.

title: Sergio 2014 Dr. Reid Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Made by proprietor Anna Monticelli, who also makes the Pina Napa Valley wines, this is a robust hearty vineyard-designate made in tiny numbers. With 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in, it offers earthy tannin and a soft muscular texture of lightly spiced oak and dark chocolate cherry.

title: Valdipiatta 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Mature plum, chopped herb and a whiff of truffle lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the ripe palate along with black cherry and a hint of star anise encased in supple tannins.

title: Vieux Château Landon 2015  Médoc
description: This 93-acre property has produced a ripe wine in this vintage, plush with red berries and black currants as well as the right amount of firm tannin. The smoky character of the wine comes from the wood aging that gives this wine aging potential. Drink from 2023.

title: Villa Crespia 2009 Millè Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: This 100% Chardonnay opens with aromas of yellow flower, golden apple and a whiff of bread crust. The fresh creamy palate has yellow Bartlett pear, lemon rind and toasted hazelnut alongside an elegant mousse.

title: Winter's Hill 2016 Reserve Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)
description: The steely, crisp fruit has been softened up a bit by barrel fermentation, which also adds a light toasty note. The core remains firm, with freshly sliced apple and pear fruit and a smooth lingering finish.

title: Boeckel 2016 Midelberg Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: A rather neutral nose nonetheless has hints of lemon zest that suggests freshness and lightness. But the palate shows tinges of lemon, fern and the merest hint of pepper. A little green pear fruit comes in, too. A very light, very subtle wine, with a long, dry finish.

title: Château Lamothe-Cissac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Under the same ownership as Château la Tonnelle, this wine comes the small village of Cissac next door to Pauillac. Dominated by Cabernet Sauvignon, it is richly structured, spicy from wood aging and juicy with black-currant fruitiness. Drink this still-firm, young wine from 2022.

title: Château Jean Faure 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Already accessible, this is a ripe, full wine layered with generous flavors of blackberry fruit. The tannins are already integrated in a wine that will age well over the medium term.

title: Château La Serre 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is ripe and spicy with smoky tobacco notes, yet it is also crisp with light footed acidity. Soft, full tannins from the dominant Merlot pull it all together. It will develop quickly.

title: Château Sansonnet 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 89–90. Barrel Sample. This wine has solid tannins balanced with juicy acidity and ripe fruit flavors. The rich texture blends admirable structure with luscious fruit. Drink this delicious wine from 2021.

title: Château Lamothe Guignard 2017 Barrel Sample  (Sauternes)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This wine has fine acidity, generous ripe-yellow fruits and a toffee character, with a dry core to balance. Drink from 2023.

title: Château du Cartillon 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. While this wine has plenty of tannins, it is the fruit that is so good here. The black currant flavors of Cabernet Sauvignon dominate and give the wine an open fruitiness. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Fourcas-Borie 2017 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. A fine balance between tannins and ripe blackcurrant fruit gives this wine its structure and immediate pleasure. It is already a very drinkable wine, with fine fruits and ripe tannins. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Saransot-Dupré 2017 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. A rich wine, this has great, dense black-fruit flavors as well as firm tannins. It's hit with pleasant smokiness and balanced by juicy acidity. It will age well, ready to drink from 2023.

title: Château de Chantegrive 2017 Cuvée Caroline Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. Rich and ripe, this wine has a dense texture and fine spice notes from the oak aging. It is a generous wine, packed with green fruits, citrus and warm apricot flavors. It will age well and be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château Ségur de Cabanac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Estèphe)
description: 89–91. Barrel Sample. This is a dense, serious wine with concentrated tannins, very much in the old style of Saint-Estèphe. It needs time for the fruit to balance with those tannins and produce a rich, structured wine. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Potensac 2015  Médoc
description: While this wine has plenty of ripe tannins, the delicious blackberry fruit speaks loudest. Ripe, full and with a fine line of acidity, it is gently structured and likely to age well. Drink this fruity wine from 2023.

title: Château Quintus 2015 Le Dragon  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Merlot dominates in this second wine of Château Quintus. Ripe, juicy and with delicious red fruits, it is smooth and lightly tannic. This wine will develop over the medium term. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Valandraud 2015 Virginie  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Produced from a small parcel of vines on the Valandraud estate, this wine is crisp and fruity, with attractive acidity. Ripe lime and lemon flavors are given extra richness by the tangy mineral texture. Drink this wine from late 2018.

title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2015 Métiss White (Alsace)
description: A wonderful hint of Mandarin peel on the nose translates onto zesty, juicy freshness on the palate. This shows ripe pear and juicy citrus, with intense echoes of tangerine peel. A highly appetizing, fruity but light and dry wine. This will get any party going.

title: Caven 2010 Inferno Al Carmine Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and a whiff of alpine herb lift out of the glass. The juicy palate offers red cherry, tobacco and a touch of white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Château de Villambis 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This wine is structured and firm, with solid tannins as well as plenty of black-currant fruit. Concentrated and packed with berry fruits, it is a wine to age, so drink from 2024. The 37-acre estate is structured to employ people with intellectual disabilities.
